results.title: Transcriptional block of AMPK-induced autophagy promotes glutamate excitotoxicity in nutrient-deprived SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells.
results.text_hl: Genetic or pharmacological @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@ activation by @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@ overexpression or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, as well as genetic or pharmacological autophagy induction by @GENE_TFEB @GENE_7942 @@@TFEB@@@ overexpression or @CHEMICAL_Lithium_Chloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018021 @@@lithium chloride@@@, reduced the sensitivity of nutrient-deprived @CELLLINE_CVCL:0019 @@@SH-SY5Y@@@ cells to @<m>DISEASE_Glutamate_formiminotransferase_deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537425 @@@glutamate excitotoxicity@@@.

citations.NLM: Vucicevic L, Misirkic M, Ciric D, Martinovic T, Jovanovic M, Isakovic A, Markovic I, Saponjic J, Foretz M, Rabanal-Ruiz Y, Korolchuk VI, Trajkovic V. Transcriptional block of AMPK-induced autophagy promotes glutamate excitotoxicity in nutrient-deprived SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells. Cell Mol Life Sci. 2020 Sep;77(17):3383-3399. PMID: 31720741
